title: Yin and Yang Part 1
instructions: Complete the sentences with the given words.

contents.gel: Yin  and  yang  are  seemingly  opposite  forces  which  are
contents.ge2: interconnected,  and  interdependent  in  the  natural  world.
to  each  other  as  they  interrelate  to  one  another.

contents.gel: Many  dualities  (such  as  light  and  dark,  fire  and  water)  are  thought  of  as  physical  manifestations  of  the  duality
This  duality  lies  at  the  origins  of  many  branches  of  classical  Chinese  science  and  philosophy,
contents.ge2: being  a  primary  guideline  of  traditional  Chinese  medicine.

contents.gel: Duality  is  found  in  many  belief  systems,  but  yin  and  yang  are  parts  of  a  Oneness  that  is  also
The  term  'dualistic-monism'  has  been  coined  in  an
contents.ge2: to  express  this  fruitful  paradox  of  simultaneous  unity  and  duality.

contents.gel: Yin  and  yang  can  be  described  as  complementary forces
